definition: to witness/to see at first hand/to see with one's own eyes
The Strange State of the World Witnessed Over 20 Years, novel by late Qing novelist Wu Jianren 吳趼人|吴趼人[Wu2 Jian3 ren2]
pinyin: Er4 shi2 Nian2 Mu4 du3 zhi1 Guai4 Xian4 zhuang4

definition: to see for oneself/to see with one's own eyes

sentences.english: His denial that he had witnessed the accident dumbfounded me.
sentences.chinese: 他否认曾亲眼目睹这一事故的发生把我惊呆了。

sentences.english: Have you ever witnessed a missile launch?
sentences.chinese: 你是否曾目睹过导弹发射？

sentences.english: The recycling volunteers and the other vendors at the market have all witnessed the change in Lin's personality.
sentences.chinese: 慈济志工和市场的其他摊贩，目睹林江能个性的改变。

sentences.english: Mary is going to die,but she will not close her eyes until she knows her book is published.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽准备走了，但先要目睹她那本书出版后才瞑目。

sentences.english: Now visitors to the reserve will have a chance to witness the same.
sentences.chinese: 而今，到保护区的游客们同样有机会目睹这样的美景。

sentences.english: Thisis the first generation of people who have grown up with bad divorces.
sentences.chinese: 这是第一代在成长过程中目睹了很多不幸婚姻的人。

sentences.english: It's the next best thing to witnessing an actual blastoff.
sentences.chinese: 这是仅次于目睹火箭真实升空的最佳选择。

sentences.english: Witnessing an earthrise made them feel humble.
sentences.chinese: 目睹地出令他们感到谦卑。

sentences.english: And she passed a crime scene where somebody was shot on the street.
sentences.chinese: 目睹了街道边的一起枪击案。

sentences.english: Neighbors saw what was happening, but were unable to prevent the toddler from falling out.
sentences.chinese: 邻居们目睹了妞妞的情况，却无力阻止。

sentences.english: If Haiti, you'll witness the the ugly side Western paternalism.
sentences.chinese: 而在海地，你会亲眼目睹到西方家长作风的丑陋面。

sentences.english: Mary was ready to go, but first she wanted her book to be in print.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽准备走了，但先要目睹她那本书出版后才瞑目。

sentences.english: Come on. You won't witness any slaughter. It's a movie.
sentences.chinese: 快别这么说，你没有目睹什么屠杀，这是一部电影。

sentences.english: He later said, "I'd seen four re-entries before this one.
sentences.chinese: 他后来说，“之前我曾经目睹过4次航天飞机返回。

sentences.english: Everyone had either seen or heard of these huge creatures and knew where the problem lay.
sentences.chinese: 像这种大型生物，大家耳闻目睹，还知道问题所在。

definition: to see for oneself/to see with one's own eyes
to look/to have a glimpse at/to observe (sth's splendor)
shaking one to the core/extremely disturbing/hair-raising (idiom)
